result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek A Kwiatkowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing
.

Complete Anger Management if PO deems it appropriate

Pay restitution - State has 60 days to determine amount.  The def will then have another 30 days to challenge that amount

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek A Kwiatkowski

Minser - Amended Info was filed on 12-30-14, we were here before DGM, he gave us opportunity to have this heard in front of another judge
Stmt of Neg Plea already on file
Def - did sign, went thru it w/ my atty, understands
Def understands CRT is not bound by recommendation & can sentence up to the max, has authority to do so...
Ct 1 - Def pleads GUILTY
Plea Quest & Waiver filed/def understands/signed
CRT finds def's plea is F&V made - finds def guilty
Ct 2 - Dismissed & read-in
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 3 yrs w/ conditions:  30 days CJ - report by 4 pm on 1-23-15;  AODA & follow-thru;  Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol, drugs or cont subs w/random testing;  Complete Anger Management if PO deems it approp.;  Pay restitution - State has 60 days to determine amt, the def will have another 30 days to challenge that amount;  Pay CC & DOC fees
Plea hearing on January 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

State by Minser / Def w/ Atty David Bolles

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
CRT goes over plea agreement w/ def
Bolles:  only issue we have is expungement
CRT:  No PSI request?
Minser:  No, since probation is the recommendation
CRT comments on sentencing...likely to impose probation & Stay a lengthy prison sentence, Mr. Bolles, would you like to discuss this w/ your client.  I can recall this @ 10am.
CASE RECALLED - SAME APPS
Bolles:  After discussing this matter, my client would like a different judge
CRT:  That will be Mulroy or Perlich - Ruth will give you another date
Plea hearing on January 5, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Plea hearing on December 30, 2014 at 09:30 am.

JS violations

I want letter from JS why scheduled testing won't work.

David Bolles

CRT does not have a problem w/ that & doesn't think JS would have problem w/ def being tested @ Whitehall.  Def can also talk to JS about having MEMS Unit.  If Tremp Co is willing to test def - he can test there.  I would approve that as condition of bond if we find out what the results are
